meanings.definition: Exhibiting an excessive pride in oneself or one's achievements.
meanings.sent1: She wore the smuggest smile after winning the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: The cat looked smuggest when it caught the mouse.
meanings.sent3: He felt smuggest when he found out he had the highest score in the class.
meanings.sent4: The peacock strutted around the farm, the smuggest bird of them all.
meanings.sent5: Her smuggest attitude made her unpopular among her classmates.

meanings.definition: Showing satisfaction or contentment with oneself in a superior manner.
meanings.sent1: The smuggest student in the class always raised his hand first.
meanings.sent2: She gave the smuggest nod of approval to her own work.
meanings.sent3: The smuggest chef in town refused to share his secret recipe.
meanings.sent4: The smuggest squirrel on the block always had the best nuts.
meanings.sent5: His smuggest grin revealed his confidence in his abilities.
